column2: MISSISSIPPI DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
column4: Mississippi
column6: MS

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Slippery when wet
column6: Steep downgrade

column2: 2. A driver distraction is anything that:
column4: causes excessive concentration while driving.
column6: takes the attention away from driving.

column2: 3. A broken yellow line between two lanes of traffic means:
column4: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column6: Passing is permitted when safe.

column2: 4. When entering an interstate highway, you should check for a gap in traffic in the nearest lane, adjust your speed to match the flow of traffic, signal and:
column4: slow down gradually.
column6: wait for the lane to be clear.
column8: merge into that gap when safe.

column2: 5. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: closely follow the driver in front of them.
column6: maintain their speed through the work zone.
column8: reduce their speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 6. This signal means:
column4: Slow down
column6: Stop

column2: 7. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: of a brake failure.
column6: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 8. If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
column4: maintain your current speed while changing lanes.
column6: make a U-turn because the lane ends ahead.
column8: be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.

column2: 9. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear
column6: You must increase your speed

column2: 10. If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
column4: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.
column6: stop where you are.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn on red light permitted
column6: No Right Turn

column2: 12. When driving through a construction zone, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop and watch for a flagger.
column6: decrease their following distance.

column2: 13. If a vehicle is coming towards you at night with its high beams on, making it hard to see the road ahead, you should:
column4: look ahead towards the left edge of your lane.
column6: look ahead towards the right edge of your lane.
column8: look straight ahead towards the middle of the lane.

column2: 14. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column6: Brake early and gently.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: Do not block intersection
column6: Merging traffic

column2: 16. If a bus needs to make a right turn and you are also turning right:
column4: squeeze between the bus and the curb.
column6: wait until the bus turns before turning right.
column8: try to turn right before the bus does.

column2: 17. Before entering an intersection, drivers should look:
column4: right, left, then right again.
column6: left.

column2: 18. When riding in a vehicle equipped with air bags is, children ages 12 and under are safer:
column4: buckled up in the front seat.
column6: in the bed of a pick-up truck.
column8: buckled up in the back seat.

column2: 19. When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
column4: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.
column6: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.
column8: slow down and adjust their driving manner.

column2: 20. When entering an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.
column6: adjust speed to meet a traffic gap, then merge at a safe speed.
column8: check for cars and slow down to 25 MPH before merging with the flow of traffic.

column2: 21. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column4: no passing zone
column6: soft shoulder

column2: 22. This sign is a:
column4: warning sign.
column6: guide sign.

column2: 23. Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:
column4: signal your intention before changing lanes.
column6: check your blind spots and, mirrors.

column2: 24. There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
column4: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
column6: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.
column8: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.

column2: 25. Green and white signs:
column4: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column6: give information about directions and distances.
column8: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.

column2: 26. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column6: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.

column2: 27. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.

column2: 28. This sign warns that:
column4: traffic must merge right.
column6: traffic must merge left.
column8: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column4: Trucks merging from the right
column6: Trucks have the right-of-way

column2: 30. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
